title: Ayub ruled out of Newlands Test due to ankle injuey - Cricbuzz
summary:
Saim Ayub Ruled Out of Newlands Test Due to Ankle Injury

Published on: Fri, Jan 3, 2025, 05:27 PM

Pakistan opener Saim Ayub has been ruled out of the ongoing Newlands Test with an ankle injury. The 22-year-old twisted his right ankle while fielding on the opening day of the second Test against South Africa, and his recovery timeline remains uncertain.

  • The injury occurred in the seventh over when Ayub slipped while attempting to field a ball.
  • He underwent X-rays and MRI tests, with reports sent to specialists in London for further advice.
  • Ayub will not participate further in the second Test and was seen in a cast after the incident.
  • He was replaced by Abdullah Shafique in the field.
  • The injury contributed to a challenging day for Pakistan, facing significant scores from South Africa's Ryan Rickelton and Temba Bavuma.
“Saim has been ruled out of further participation in the second men's cricket Test against South Africa after twisting his right ankle while fielding,” the PCB stated.

This injury poses concerns for Pakistan as they navigate a tough match against South Africa.
newTitle: Saim Ayub Ruled Out of Newlands Test Due to Ankle Injury

  • Wind: Northeast at 19 km/h with gusts up to 39 km/h.
  • Probability of rainfall: 2%.

IND vs AUS Weather Forecast: Afternoon Conditions

  • Wind increases to 30 km/h with gusts up to 48 km/h.

summary:
Mohammad Kaif Critiques Selectors for Dropping Rohit Sharma in Sydney Test

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif expressed his disagreement with the team management regarding the decision to drop captain Rohit Sharma from the playing XI for the crucial Sydney Test against Australia. He believed that the captain should have been included irrespective of recent performances.

  • Kaif highlighted that dropping Rohit Sharma, especially before a crucial match, sends the wrong message.
  • He pointed out that several top batsmen, including Virat Kohli, are also struggling to score runs.
  • Amidst criticism, Kaif emphasized that Sharma's leadership qualities are essential for the team.
  • Reports suggest that this could be Rohit Sharma's last Test after missing the series opener due to personal reasons.
"You cannot drop him. The captain can never be dropped. If you win, it's with the captain; if you lose, you lose with the captain." - Mohammad Kaif

Kaif's remarks have sparked discussions among fans and analysts about player selection and team dynamics, especially in high-stakes matches.

title: Ryan Rickelton, Temba Bavuma centuries drive South Africa's day - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Ryan Rickelton, Temba Bavuma centuries drive South Africa's day

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: ESPN Cricinfo

On a perfect batting day at Newlands, Ryan Rickelton and Temba Bavuma scored centuries, leading South Africa to a strong position against Pakistan.

The duo put together a record 235-run partnership for the fourth wicket against Pakistan, demonstrating their batting prowess on a flat pitch.

  • Rickelton scored an impressive 176 not out, while Bavuma added 106 runs.
  • Their partnership is the highest for the fourth wicket by South African batsmen against Pakistan.
  • Pakistan's Saim Ayub suffered a match-ending injury early in the session.
  • South Africa capitalized on favorable batting conditions, contrasting with last year's match conditions.
  • Bavuma struck his first six and showcased his form with aggressive shots.
“Bavuma has scored three of his four Test hundreds and averages 57.78 since taking over as captain.”

This performance solidifies South Africa's strong position in the ongoing Test match against Pakistan.
newTitle: Rickelton and Bavuma Shine in South Africa vs. Pakistan Test

title: Forgotten India Star Scripts History, Registers World Record Ahead Of IPL 2025 - NDTV Sports
summary:
Karun Nair Sets World Record Ahead of IPL 2025

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: NDTV Sports

Karun Nair made history by setting the record for the most List A runs without being dismissed, achieving a remarkable total of 542 runs during the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • Nair surpassed the previous record of 527 runs held by James Franklin since 2010.
  • His latest performance included a score of 112 runs, contributing significantly to Vidarbha's win against Uttar Pradesh.
  • Yash Rathod also showcased an impressive performance with an unbeaten 138 runs, leading to Vidarbha's successful chase of 308 runs.
  • Vidarbha secured their position at the top of Group D with 20 points from five matches.
“Karun's fourth hundred in the tournament highlights his exceptional form.”

This achievement places Karun Nair in the spotlight ahead of the IPL 2025, marking a noteworthy comeback in his cricket career.

Former Indian cricketer Irfan Pathan criticized Virat Kohli after he repeated a mistake during a match in Sydney against Australia, highlighting the need for discipline in his gameplay.

  • Kohli was dismissed chasing a wide delivery by Scott Boland, scoring only 17 runs.

  • He compared Kohli unfavorably to Sachin Tendulkar, claiming that Kohli lacks the same range of shots.

  • India was all out for 185 in the match, currently trailing by 176 runs.

Pathan noted that great players learn from their mistakes, which Kohli seems to be repeating frequently. He calls for Kohli to develop a more disciplined batting technique to improve his performance.

On Day 1 of the 5th Test in Sydney, India set a target of 185 runs, with Australia ending the day at 9/1, trailing by 176 runs. Jasprit Bumrah starred for India, taking the lone Australian wicket at stumps.

  • India won the toss and opted to bat first, scoring 185 runs.

  • Scott Boland was the standout bowler for Australia, claiming four wickets.

  • India is expected to reveal its final squad by January 11, with a deadline for submissions on January 12.
  • The tournament will start on February 19 in Karachi, and the final will occur on March 9 in Lahore or Dubai.

summary:
Karun Nair Sets New List A Record for Most Runs Without Being Dismissed

Date: 03-Jan-2025 • Source: PTI

Karun Nair broke the world record for the most List A runs without being dismissed, scoring 112 runs and achieving a total of 542 runs without getting out, surpassing the previous record held by James Franklin.

  • Nair's unbeaten streak started on December 23, with a significant performance against Jammu & Kashmir.
  • He registered his fourth century of the season and helped Vidarbha secure an eight-wicket victory over Uttar Pradesh.
  • Nair's record-breaking innings included a partnership of 228 runs with Yash Rathod.
  • Vidarbha currently leads Group D with 20 points from five games.
“Nair, who smashed 112, set a new record of 542 runs without being dismissed.”

This remarkable achievement not only highlights Nair's talent and consistency but also emphasizes Vidarbha's strength in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
newTitle: Karun Nair Sets New List A Record for Most Runs Without Being Dismissed

title: 'Downplayed Magnus' attacks on Viswanathan Anand': FIDE CEO destroys Carlsen after controversial Rapid and Blitz C'ship - Hindustan Times
summary:
FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky Takes Aim at Magnus Carlsen Amid Championship Controversy

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Emil Sutovsky, the CEO of FIDE, has criticized World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen following controversies at the World Rapid and Blitz Championship, particularly regarding comments made about former world champion Vishwanathan Anand.

  • Sutovsky responded to Carlsen's accusations about threats made against players in the Freestyle Chess Tour.
  • He highlighted Carlsen's sharing of the World Blitz title and his controversial comments urging short draws.
  • Sutovsky questioned why the media downplayed Carlsen's attacks on Anand.
  • He expressed his commitment to transparency and criticism of Carlsen's PR strategies.
  • Recent agreements between FIDE and the Freestyle Chess Players Club were mentioned, which recognize the Grand Slam Tour.
“It is funny how some platforms/streamers downplay the 'we can just keep making draws' case. Exactly as they downplayed Magnus' attacks on Vishy 3 days before.”

Sutovsky's comments reflect ongoing tensions in the chess community and the implications of media portrayal of events.
newTitle: FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky Takes Aim at Magnus Carlsen Amid Championship Controversy
